It's worth noting that Mr. Ng could be sipping piña coladas on a private island for the rest of his life but he's teaching people–free of charge–knowledge that can change your life.
yay!

I think, It depends on what are the "features" i.e. "input" for your algorithm. Typically, in CV context, the input is an image. And the image is just a bunch of pixels. So, roughly speaking, your pixels are your features. So it does not make sense to throw away some pixels. In case of cropping - it is preprocessing technique - not one of features. But if, for example, your input is not a raw image but a bunch of "extracted features" like what is the average "green" value across all pixels, then, yes, such features you can throw away. But those are very rare cases. In majority of cases in cv, you are working with images
I think it’s uniform to kind of ensure randomness
Yes, otherwise you’d have a weighted average.
